There are several ways that we can support Native American communities today. It is important to first acknowledge the harm that past actions have caused and work to address these injustices.

One way to support Native American communities is to learn about their histories and cultures. This can involve reading books and articles by Native American authors, attending cultural events and festivals, and visiting museums and cultural centers that showcase Native American art and history.

Another way to support Native American communities is to advocate for their rights and work to address the ongoing issues they face. This can involve supporting organizations that fight for Native American rights or that provide resources and support to Native American communities.

Volunteering with Native American organizations or supporting Native-owned businesses is also a way to provide support. Additionally, donations to organizations that provide aid to Native American communities can make a real difference.

Ultimately, it is important to recognize that Native American communities have agency and that they are the experts on their own needs and priorities. By listening to and supporting their voices, we can work towards creating a more just and equitable society for all.
